alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Parksley, or 14 miles south of Pocomoke City, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hallwood, Horntown, Boxiron, Mappsville, Greenbackville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Oak Hall, Assawoman, Atlantic, Girdletree, Stockton and New Church. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
